story:
" If you build it, we will come "                                                            Believe it or not, major league teams are already asking about our ProFile Baseball product, sort of like the Voice whispering to farmer Ray Kinsella in Field of Dreams.

I’m a high-heeled Creative Director/Marketing type, but here’s my dream – a custom app that:

·  helps young players chase their dreams

·  taps into the Moneyball technology boom ($3.5bil and growing)

·  returns a percentage to local sports and charities

That’s gotta be a triple, at least.

The ProFile Baseball app started not in an Iowa cornfield but a lawyer’s boardroom. We were pitching a website for sports agents to showcase their talent – basically a ballplayer trading card, with video – and someone said, “What else could it do?” We brainstormed some more, knocked a few things out of the park, ditched the lawyers, secured the rights and took it to the pros. 

This 3 min. Video shows how ProFile Apps work.


“I would’ve given up my rent money for this!” said Mark Acre, former A’s pitcher. “Back when I was trying to make it to the Show, something like this would’ve been big!” Mark saw how easy it was to build your own profile, demonstrate skill development and share it with potential scouts and coaches. He helped us present it to Oakland A’s pitching coach Gil Patterson – while they were filming Moneyball, in fact – and Gil showed us how he wanted the software and dual-play video to function. (And now it does.)

And just like that, a cool, new, major league-inspired product ideal for the $150 billion baseball market was born. 

But, I'm also a mom... and I always think of kids. So before proceeding, I wondered how ProFile could help them, too?

Two ways, it turns out.

First, as Mark Acre recognized, ProFile is a great way to get noticed. It creates clear, verified, objective stats and video which any kid, boy or girl, from Little League through college, can share with the next level up.


The sweet spot is for high school players. NCAA and MLB rules forbid direct contact to players under seventeen. But you know they’re looking. That’s why parents fork over thousands of dollars so their kids can be seen at expensive camps and club tournaments. ProFile levels the field through its immediate, consistent, easy-access data, showcasing athletes as they earn direct access to the recruiters and scouts they want to meet. Just like that, you’re in the game.

Secondly, and just as importantly, ProFile gives back to kids. Instead of handing out a simple scorekeeping app then charging users to attend expensive tournaments, ProFile flips that.  We’ll charge a modest rate for our products, then sponsor local, not-for-profit tournaments and sports clinics, splitting the proceeds between the hosting team/league and their charity of choice. That’s the mom in me talking.

And that’s my field of dreams. A home-run app for kids, competitors and pros. A field-tested profit maker for the big leagues and, more importantly, a chance for everyone with a dream to get their fair turn at the plate.

It’s all teed up. Will you help me hit this out of the park?


Do you love a baseball player?

Help them get connected with ProFile's Baseball App. There is a gap in the baseball marketplace between athletes and the coaches and scouts who want to meet them. NCAA forbids recruiters and scouts from approaching young athletes before their Jr. year in high school, but college and major league coaches are interested in more information about athletes at an earlier age. Athletes want to meet the recruiters and scouts, but don't know how to go about it. ProFile provides the best way for them to directly connect.

Give them a better way to get a sport scholarship

High school prospects feel like they may be missing out on opportunities and parents are paying dearly ($4000 per year average) to give their kids an advantage in getting the attention of colleges or scouts at year-round club ball tournaments.

Pros Have been struggling with complicated, and expensive software to track play and stats and have been paying for licensing on software they will never own.Like Money Ball for High School Athletes...

Our contacts in MLB tell us that coaches want an integrated training solution with a direct communication tool between players and scouts to instruct athletes and team members in a closed loop system – nothing has worked until ProFile, as an all-in-one solution. 

ProFile provides a beautifully consistent and professional way to present an athlete's achievements easily and affordable. All-the-while putting the information and reports into standardized formats that are easy to search, compare and provide the verification scouts and managers want.


With Dual Playing Video Comparisons

Too much time and money ($35,000,000 annually) is spent on scouting prospects that do not really perform at the level claimed – Teams need VERIFIED stats! Currently, stats can be exaggerated by other software and well-meaning parents and coaches who are motivated to promote their players.


Keep your eye on the ball with Five Touch score keeping...no scrolling, no drop down menus.

ProFile takes analytics to a whole new level! With MicoStats(TM) ProFile learns your game, and can predict how an individual athlete will most probably perform against a known opponent or situation. MicroStats will change the way baseball is coached! 

Customizable Game Reports

ProFile will revolutionize the way athletes are selected and will rank athletes in order of skill!  Not on how often you play or how rich you parents are.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • ProFile was started by Diana Barrows, entrepreneur and fortune 500 marketing expert and JP Morgan, sales and marketing training/manager with ties to professional sports. JP worked with and trained our first sales representative: Marc Acre, former pitcher with the Oakland A's and through his contacts we met Coach Gil Patterson, who upon seeing the ProFile demo became very excited. Coach Gill joined in our efforts and was instrumental in guiding the design and functionality of the software from a power user's point of view. Coach Gil is now the Director of Pitching for the New York Yankees.  Together we have been working on this project for two years - completely self-funded! And we are SO close! We have tested the BETA version of the mobile App. We will have the i-Pad score keeping app ready to test in a couple of weeks. But we can't go to market until we finish the user interface design and the code for the look and feel of the ProFile Bio Pages. We need just $10,000 more to complete this phase and launch ProFile Baseball on all the App stores. After that, we strongly believe that the sales of the apps will fund our expansion into other sports. We began with baseball because it is the hardest, and most statistically intensive. Once we succeed with the baseball app, we can transfer the technology and everything we have learned to every other sport. This is going to be huge! 


    • So, for every contribution over $10 to the funding of Profile, and your feedback on testing the app, ProFile will list your name in the appreciation section of the website and on the app. ProFile will also provide a FREE subscription and use of the ProFile Baseball Mobile App for one year. 



    Choose your favorite Tee Shirt design

  • For every contribution over $25, ProFile You get your choice of these fun ProFile Sports Tee Shirts...plus everything listed above for a $10 donation.
  • For every contribution over $50, ProFile will provide all the above, and the ProFile Baseball BioPage subscription FREE to you for one year.
  • For every contribution over $100, ProFile will also provide the ProFile Baseball BioPage subscription FREE to you for two years and a logo Tee Shirt and mention on the website and in the credits of the app. 
  • For contributions over $1000, ProFile will supply all the above and your entire team with FREE use of the ProFile i-Pad scorekeeping app (i-Pad not included) and FREE ProFile Baseball mobile app subscriptions to your entire team! 
  • Above Perks are transferable as a gift to an athlete or team of your choice.
  • If for any reason we do not raise the full amount required, we will put everything we do receive into completing as much of the user interface as possible and continue to pay for the launch with our day jobs... because there is no going back now! no quitting and no reason not to. ProFile is a needed solution for athletes and for teams, it's fair, affordable and will revolutionize how sports are coached and how athletes are selected.

The Impact

  • We know we are on to something big - because our market research tell us that student athletes are creating their own bio-pages in an attempt to market themselves and look more attractive to college recruiters. Some include video, and action photos and stats, but they are not connected to a big database and can not be easily found or compared to other athletes. Why spend hundreds of dollars and countless hours building your own bio page that may never be seen when ProFile can provide an elegant and easy solution for as low as $4.99 per month? !!!

  • Predictive MicroStats(TM) will provide a strategic advantage to the early adapters of ProFile applications
  • ProFile learns your game will provide you with personal tips tailored to aid you in improving your game.
    Our sales reps are X-pro ball players with great connections and we just happen to be located in the heart of Spring Training territory...



    ProFile helps kids through sports - without breaking their parents bank!

  • ProFile will sponsor Not-for-profit baseball tournaments and clinics as a way to introduce the ProFile product line to athletes and coaches. The proceeds will be given back to little league organizations and charities that help children in every community were ProFile events are held. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our ProFile baseball product and would like to help, but do not have money to contribute there are still lots of ways that you can assist ProFile in reaching our goals:

1. You can forward this indiegogo link to your friends  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/profile-sports-baseball-apps-and-bio-pages

2. You can friend us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/ProFileBaseball 

3. or follow us on twitter @ProFileSports1

4. You can test our demo and provide feedback http://profilebaseball.com/Feedback-form.html on our website by clicking the demo button (you don't even need an i-phone to try it)  http://6profilebaseball.com/

5. You can refer other athletes to our page at igg.me/at/profile

6. Or send your rich friends to our Gust site:  https://gust.com/companies/profile_sports_llc

MicroStats will change the way baseball is coached! Customizable Game ReportsProFile will revolutionize the way athletes are selected and will rank athletes in order of skill!  Not on how often you play or how rich you parents are.  What We Need & What You Get
ProFile was started by Diana Barrows, entrepreneur and fortune 500 marketing expert and JP Morgan, sales and marketing training/manager with ties to professional sports. JP worked with and trained our first sales representative: Marc Acre, former pitcher with the Oakland A's and through his contacts we met Coach Gil Patterson, who upon seeing the ProFile demo became very excited. Coach Gill joined in our efforts and was instrumental in guiding the design and functionality of the software from a power user's point of view. Coach Gil is now the Director of Pitching for the New York Yankees.  Together we have been working on this project for two years - completely self-funded! And we are SO close! We have tested the BETA version of the mobile App. We will have the i-Pad score keeping app ready to test in a couple of weeks. But we can't go to market until we finish the user interface design and the code for the look and feel of the ProFile Bio Pages. We need just $10,000 more to complete this phase and launch ProFile Baseball on all the App stores. After that, we strongly believe that the sales of the apps will fund our expansion into other sports. We began with baseball because it is the hardest, and most statistically intensive. Once we succeed with the baseball app, we can transfer the technology and everything we have learned to every other sport. This is going to be huge! 
So, for every contribution over $10 to the funding of Profile, and your feedback on testing the app, ProFile will list your name in the appreciation section of the website and on the app. ProFile will also provide a FREE subscription and use of the ProFile Baseball Mobile App for one year. 




Choose your favorite Tee Shirt design

For every contribution over $25, ProFile You get your choice of these fun ProFile Sports Tee Shirts...plus everything listed above for a $10 donation.
For every contribution over $50, ProFile will provide all the above, and the ProFile Baseball BioPage subscription FREE to you for one year.
For every contribution over $100, ProFile will also provide the ProFile Baseball BioPage subscription FREE to you for two years and a logo Tee Shirt and mention on the website and in the credits of the app. 
For contributions over $1000, ProFile will supply all the above and your entire team with FREE use of the ProFile i-Pad scorekeeping app (i-Pad not included) and FREE ProFile Baseball mobile app subscriptions to your entire team! 
Above Perks are transferable as a gift to an athlete or team of your choice.
If for any reason we do not raise the full amount required, we will put everything we do receive into completing as much of the user interface as possible and continue to pay for the launch with our day jobs... because there is no going back now! no quitting and no reason not to. ProFile is a needed solution for athletes and for teams, it's fair, affordable and will revolutionize how sports are coached and how athletes are selected.
The ImpactWe know we are on to something big - because our market research tell us that student athletes are creating their own bio-pages in an attempt to market themselves and look more attractive to college recruiters. Some include video, and action photos and stats, but they are not connected to a big database and can not be easily found or compared to other athletes. Why spend hundreds of dollars and countless hours building your own bio page that may never be seen when ProFile can provide an elegant and easy solution for as low as $4.99 per month? !!!


Predictive MicroStats(TM) will provide a strategic advantage to the early adapters of ProFile applications
ProFile learns your game will provide you with personal tips tailored to aid you in improving your game.Our sales reps are X-pro ball players with great connections and we just happen to be located in the heart of Spring Training territory...

ProFile helps kids through sports - without breaking their parents bank!


ProFile will sponsor Not-for-profit baseball tournaments and clinics as a way to introduce the ProFile product line to athletes and coaches. The proceeds will be given back to little league organizations and charities that help children in every community were ProFile events are held. 

Other Ways You Can HelpIf you like our ProFile baseball product and would like to help, but do not have money to contribute there are still lots of ways that you can assist ProFile in reaching our goals:1. You can forward this indiegogo link to your friends  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/profile-sports-baseball-apps-and-bio-pages2. You can friend us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/ProFileBaseball 3. or follow us on twitter @ProFileSports14. You can test our demo and provide feedback http://profilebaseball.com/Feedback-form.html on our website by clicking the demo button (you don't even need an i-phone to try it)  http://6profilebaseball.com/5. You can refer other athletes to our page at igg.me/at/profile6. Or send your rich friends to our Gust site:  https://gust.com/companies/profile_sports_llc

story:
WHAT IS TALLISTON HOUSE & GARDENS?

Talliston House & Gardens is a project that has taken the most ordinary of English dwellings – a three-bedroomed, semi-detached, ex-council house in Essex – and over two and a half decades has painstakingly transformed it into a magical labyrinth of locations, each set in a different time and place.

After years of design, research, sourcing and construction, each room or garden is infused with a rich story, incorporating over 1,650 antiques and authentic objects sourced from 27 countries across the globe. With a name that means ‘the hidden place’, Talliston is not just an interior design project. Instead, it is a growing community venue that serves as an inspirational wonderland for writers, artists, craftspeople, and anyone seeking the extraordinary within the ordinary.

And all this has been accomplished by an ordinary team of people – all inspired by the project’s unique vision. 


The main living and dining room: BEFORE & AFTER

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Started in 1990, the Talliston project has been solely funded by private monies. Yet recently, the culmination of over two decades of design, sourcing and rebuilding is threatened due to financial difficulties. Talliston House & Gardens is now seeking financial support from anyone who wants to see this unique and magical place saved and its future secured forever.

We know the ultimate funding goal is ambitious, but laid out below is every financial target we need to reach to save the project – and even a small amount for enough people will be enough to keep the project alive.

We hope you’ll support Talliston with your generous donation and become part of this unique and exciting journey.

FIND OUT MORE:

Project website: Talliston.com

Photographic timeline of the entire 24-year project: Talliston House & Gardens

Friends of Talliston community page: The Friends of Talliston

Quarterly newsletter sign up and download: Talliston Times

A QUICK TOUR OF WHAT’S BEEN ACCOMPLISHED SO FAR

Here’s a quick look at the rooms completed in the house so far to appreciate the detail and uniqueness of each location – with some videos to illustrate the stories and themes behind each location.

ROOM 3: The Watchtower | Living & dining room : The Mead Hall of Twr-â-Gân (The Tower of Song) | 1887 | Wales, United Kingdom


ROOM 4: The Voodoo Kitchen | Kitchen extension : Manse L’Estrange | 1954 | Louisiana, USA


ROOM 5: The Boathouse | Bathroom : The Lightkeeper’s House | 1986 | Hamarøy, Norway

ROOM 6: The Fountain Courtyard | Back garden : Tigh Samhraidh (Summerhouse Cottage) | 1933 | County Meath, Ireland

ROOM 9: The Haunted Bedroom | Master bedroom : Master Jack’s Bedroom | 1911 | Scotland, United Kingdom

ROOM 10: The Room Of Dreams | Guest bedroom : Eish Al Kamar (The Moon’s Nest) | 1977 | Grenada, Spain

ROOM 11: The Office | Box-room : Trevelyan Vean | 1929 | New York, New York, USA

ROOM 12: The Treehouse Sanctuary | Attic : San Phra Phum (The House of the Spirits) | 1965 | Tonlé Sap, Cambodia

ROOM 13: The Tipi | Tent : Bah-Has-Tkih (The Lost Room) | 2002 | Arizona, USA – Talliston's travelling room!


WHAT YOUR SUPPORT WILL ACHIEVE

Here is a breakdown of each of the targets we hope to achieve with this campaign.

TARGET #1: £40,000 – FUNDING OPERATIONAL COSTS

The monthly running costs of the house and gardens are around £2,500. If Talliston reaches this first target, it will have secured funding from today until the completion date of October 2015. Unfortunately, this does not include any monies designated for the rooms yet to be completed.

TARGET #2: £75,000 – COMPLETING ROOM #1: THE LABYRINTH

The front garden at Talliston is based around an eighteenth century Anglican rectory house built upon a prehistoric standing stone circle – including a powerful earth-fast stone at the centre of the Yorkstone pathways. Stepping through the hornbeam thicket, you'll enter a beautiful yet practical Victorian Gothic Revival labyrinth garden with working vegetable patch and knotwork cottage style garden.

Our inspiration:

Still to be completed in this location:

• clearing mud, rubble, rubbish, digging and replacing topsoil

• adding irrigation and water channels, pump, pipes, etc. 

• creating the flint knapped retaining walls

• laying central and side brick paths that form the lower labyrinth walkways

• plant the entire garden with over 1,500+ plants and flowers

• designing, sourcing and building front porch

• constructing the garden coldframes for planting seedlings

• buying the period tools, vintage wheelbarrows, etc. that will be used to work on the garden

• final planting of the cottage and vegetable gardens

TARGET #3: £125,000 – COMPLETING ROOM 8: THE STARHOUSE

We are halfway through transforming what began as a patch of concrete at the side of the house into a Steampunk-inspired futuristic room called The Starhouse. When completed it will mix the styles of a Japanese tea house and an ocean-going liner from the Golden Age of travel.

Our inspiration:

Still to be completed in this location:

• Finishing the honeycomb parquet flooring

• Installing the skirting board heating to create a controllable temperature

• Installing the ferns, bamboo, orchids and other plants

• Sourcing futuristic sofas, Gotham-styled furniture and Japanese cabinetry and tables

• Fitting the shuttering and bamboo blinds on all walls and windows

• Installing nine silver birches to form the illusion of a white forest of trunks

TARGET #4: £150,000 – COMPLETING ROOM 2: THE HALL OF MIRRORS

Built as a summer palace in northern Italy, we are reimagining the hall and stairs as a solar staircase in a now abandoned and forgotten ruin.

Our inspiration:

Still to be completed in this location:

• Laying black and white chessboard marble flooring

• Adding stonework walls to bottom entrance hall, stairway and upper landing.

• Creating stone staircase with ironwork balusters and railing.

• Creating stained glass skylight roof

• Creating Roman columns and arches

• Adding plasterwork and Italian stone features

• Installing niches and Italian busts of gods and goddesses

• Painting frescoes on walls and ceilings

TARGET #5: £175,000 – COMPLETING ROOM 7: THE CABIN

The Cabin interior is a reconstruction of a hand-built and functional trapper’s wilderness log cabin in the depths of the Canadian wilds of Saskatchewan.

Still to be completed in this location:

• Installing hand-cut timber flooring

• Carving and constructing the wooden interiors and folk art designs

• Creating the storeroom area

• Creating the underfloor areas and trapdoor

• Sourcing and installing the rustic furniture

• Installing the wood burning stove

• Building The Snug – a raised galleried bed area

• Sourcing fabrics and fittings

• Folk painting the walls and furniture

ULTIMATE TARGET #6: £250,000 – CREATING THE TALLISTON TRUST

If Talliston reaches its fundraising goals, not only will it finish the entire project, but the monies raised will also create a permanent trust to ensure the house and gardens are secured for everyone to enjoy forever.

A last word from just some of our hardworking team of volunteers...

story:
My passion is serving raw vegan, vegan and vegetarian foods for a whole mind, body & spirit.  

My goal is to obtain my teaching certificate and associate chef certificate. I am registered in the Living Light Culinary International School in Fort Bragg, CA.
I need $ 7,000.00 for tuition, room & board. It is a 21 day course - no breaks - very intensive.
Your contribution will help me achieve a dream of healing people with food as their medicine:
"Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food"

I recently was the VIP Chef at the Solar Living Institute's Harvest Moon Festival on September 6th in Hopland, CA. We fed approx. 100 people raw vegan and vegan delights. I've also prepared raw foods and treats for large events Cafe Gratitude in San Rafael, CA. I would love to be able to continue the momentum on that scale as well as give classes.

If you cannot contribute, please help by sharing this with your friends.
Any money raised will go towards tuition, housing and educational items needed.
Thank you!

story:
The donation would benefit the school community by giving students in the Tomorrow River Community Charter School's (TRCCS) Upper Grades classroom additional support. This classroom has 22 4th, 5th and 6th grade students. The population of students are very diverse with over 35% of the students having a wide variety of special needs. The school strives to develop students who are confident, engaged and prepared to go out into the world and make a difference. To fully prepare these students and to follow our mission we need additional support in this classroom. This support will ensure our students are exceeding expectations and working to their full potential.

The money will go to the Tomorrow River Community Charter School, a 501c3 non-profit charter school. This school is free and open to any student who would like to attend. The donation will be used to compensate an additional teacher/assistant for the Upper Grades classroom. This position falls outside of our operating budget.

TRCCS is in its' second year of operation and has doubled in size since its first year with waiting lists for many of the classes. Our curriculum is inspired by Waldorf and Environmental Education. We are creating a unique learning environment where children have hands-on learning opportunities with nature and art interwoven into traditional subjects. We understand that traditional learning environments work for some, but not all students and we wanted to develop a school in a community where there were no alternative schooling options. We strive to give students all of the tools they need to have success and these funds will help us reach that goal. Thanks for considering a donation!

story:
What is Hope Haven Rwanda?

By loving and investing in the people of Rwanda, we provide HOPE that empowers Rwandans to move beyond the past, break the cycle of poverty and rise up economically, intellectually, and spiritually as an educated people. 

Join Our Force & Receive Thanks...

Hope Haven Rwanda is asking for your help to raise $275,000 to build a Primary Education Building on our land. The impact of this educational space will be significant by educating 120 additional children in the rural village of Murindi, Rwanda before the 2015 calendar school year begins. Currently our school has enrolled 210 students. The new building will also include our second computer lab! Not only does this educate children and adults in Murindi, but it also provides over one hundred jobs for families that otherwise would have no opportunity for employment in the community. Families around the community provide the very hands that build that construction projects. They show up daily to the land to work and we pay them, as well as educate their children.  Every dollar you give is another step towards achieving this necessary goal. We feel blessed to partner with you in bringing a better future to the children and their families in Murindi by opening up new opportunities for them to participate in the greater Rwandan society and become part of the global community.

Donors can receive the following as thanks for their contribution... 

  • We are putting together a large textile collage inside the classrooms that you are helping to build. On each piece of the textile collage, we will embroider YOUR name onto the fabric if you donate $100 or more. This will give an artistic feel to the classrooms while reflecting the beautiful textiles of the countries and the talents of the people there. This will also provide another job for a local in Rwanda. 
  • We are giving out bracelets, made my the hands of women on our land in Rwanda, to people who donate $500 or more. You will receive two bracelets, one for yourself and one for a friend! Let them know about Rwanda! 
  • We are also etching YOUR NAME on a brick if you donate $1,000 or more! These bricks will make up a walkway on the campus for guests, students, and community families to see. We see you, and they will, too!
  • Lastly, we are having a raffle when we meet our goal of $275,000! This raffle is for a trip for two to Rwanda, all expenses paid! Come visit us on the land and see what your money has done! Every $5,000 you donate gets you a ticket into this raffle!  Read more about this below.

Education is Key!

After the genocide in 1994 Rwanda was turned upside down. The country’s instability led to a demolished economy. Major steps are being taken by the Rwanda government to rehabilitate the nation’s economy by multiplying sustainable jobs within the country and striving to export goods.

Today Rwanda has one of the fastest growing economies in Africa. The economic growth has significantly reduced the percentage of the population living in poverty and this is only the beginning of he government's 20 year plan. To sustain the current progress, there must be GOOD education available for the people of Rwanda. This is where we are making a difference.

By donating to this building project, you are directly helping to educate Rwandan families, enhance the standard of living for a community, encourage the economic growth and facilitate overall stability for the future of Rwanda by providing educated and technology savvy children and adults with skills appropriate for future employment. We have computer labs provided by donations and a software grant from Microsoft. Learning to use technology will result in students having the skills necessary for working in the modern world and becoming part of the global community by broadening their horizons.

Photo of our nursery building that is currently in use and holds 90 children.

Where We Are Now?

We started with a piece of empty land teaching students in a tent, under a tree and in an old house.  We currently have Nationally approved architectural plans for the next buildings to be constructed as part of the HHR campus. To date, we have completed a nursery building with bathrooms, one of six primary school buildings with bathrooms, a computer server room, a guard tower, dormitory, kitchen, five total cabins for the guest living quarters, an invaluable and necessary well for fresh water, and a septic system. We currently have 210 students enrolled in our school for the 2014 school year. We provide daily jobs for 100 families in the community on our land. What was once one of the poorest communities in all of Rwanda, is now a HAVEN OF HOPE for hundreds of families. 

Where We Are Going?

We are going to continue to provide jobs for Murindi, unite this community with opportunities, and educate the children and adults. We plan to complete five more primary buildings, a school meeting hall, another kitchen, and more bathrooms on the Hope Haven campus. We estimate another $2.5 million will be needed complete the entire project but we're taking each step carefully as part of completing and sustaining the entire HHR vision. 

Rendering of finished construction project for Hope Haven's dream facility.

Architect's rendering of building next to the finished building. 

We are sending two people to Rwanda. 

For every $5000 you donate, you get one raffle ticket for our drawing of an all-expense paid trip for two to Rwanda, only AFTER we meet our goal! We want you, our supporters,to see how your donation is changing the lives of this community and especially bringing new hope to these children for a more productive future. Please encourage your friends to join you in supporting HHR, so everyone has a chance to win that donates $5000!

When we reach our fundraising goal, you will automatically be entered in our raffle with your purchased ticket(s) to win a trip to Rwanda to visit Hope Haven. 

Trip dates are flexible to the prize-winner. You will be staying in a guest house on the Hope Haven campus, and food produced in the community will be provided.

All of the money we raise will go towards building a primary school building on the Hope Haven Rwanda land in Murindi. 

Because we are so appreciative of every penny of your donation, it all is used for the building project and outfitting the classrooms. This will not be possible without your help.

If you want to know more about our educational program, want to see and read more about our plans, and learn more about Hope Haven Rwanda, or have any other questions/comments/concerns please contact us at susan@hopehavenrwanda.org and visit our website hopehavenrwanda.org and Facebook page!

Additional Ways You Can Help

Everyone can contribute something which can help in a big ways!

  • Get the word out about Hope Haven Rwanda on social media and check us out on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook!
  • Share this Indiegogo page with everyone you know! We have an easy share link at the top! Maybe you know someone that wants to help us meet our funding goals! 
  • Tell your friends, family, mailman, dentist, church leader... everyone needs to know about what is happening in Rwanda!  Thank you <3

Check out our gallery of videos and photos! Tab is at the top!

Not only does this educate children and adults in Murindi, but it also provides over one hundred jobs for families that otherwise would have no opportunity for employment in the community. Families around the community provide the very hands that build that construction projects. They show up daily to the land to work and we pay them, as well as educate their children.  Every dollar you give is another step towards achieving this necessary goal. We feel blessed to partner with you in bringing a better future to the children and their families in Murindi by opening up new opportunities for them to participate in the greater Rwandan society and become part of the global community.Donors can receive the following as thanks for their contribution... 
We are putting together a large textile collage inside the classrooms that you are helping to build. On each piece of the textile collage, we will embroider YOUR name onto the fabric if you donate $100 or more. This will give an artistic feel to the classrooms while reflecting the beautiful textiles of the countries and the talents of the people there. This will also provide another job for a local in Rwanda. 
We are giving out bracelets, made my the hands of women on our land in Rwanda, to people who donate $500 or more. You will receive two bracelets, one for yourself and one for a friend! Let them know about Rwanda! 

We are also etching YOUR NAME on a brick if you donate $1,000 or more! These bricks will make up a walkway on the campus for guests, students, and community families to see. We see you, and they will, too!
Lastly, we are having a raffle when we meet our goal of $275,000! This raffle is for a trip for two to Rwanda, all expenses paid! Come visit us on the land and see what your money has done! Every $5,000 you donate gets you a ticket into this raffle!  Read more about this below.
Education is Key!After the genocide in 1994 Rwanda was turned upside down. The country’s instability led to a demolished economy. Major steps are being taken by the Rwanda government to rehabilitate the nation’s economy by multiplying sustainable jobs within the country and striving to export goods.Today Rwanda has one of the fastest growing economies in Africa. The economic growth has significantly reduced the percentage of the population living in poverty and this is only the beginning of he government's 20 year plan. To sustain the current progress, there must be GOOD education available for the people of Rwanda. This is where we are making a difference.By donating to this building project, you are directly helping to educate Rwandan families, enhance the standard of living for a community, encourage the economic growth and facilitate overall stability for the future of Rwanda by providing educated and technology savvy children and adults with skills appropriate for future employment. We have computer labs provided by donations and a software grant from Microsoft. Learning to use technology will result in students having the skills necessary for working in the modern world and becoming part of the global community by broadening their horizons.Photo of our nursery building that is currently in use and holds 90 children.Where We Are Now?We started with a piece of empty land teaching students in a tent, under a tree and in an old house.  We currently have Nationally approved architectural plans for the next buildings to be constructed as part of the HHR campus. To date, we have completed a nursery building with bathrooms, one of six primary school buildings with bathrooms, a computer server room, a guard tower, dormitory, kitchen, five total cabins for the guest living quarters, an invaluable and necessary well for fresh water, and a septic system. We currently have 210 students enrolled in our school for the 2014 school year. We provide daily jobs for 100 families in the community on our land. What was once one of the poorest communities in all of Rwanda, is now a HAVEN OF HOPE for hundreds of families. Where We Are Going?We are going to continue to provide jobs for Murindi, unite this community with opportunities, and educate the children and adults. We plan to complete five more primary buildings, a school meeting hall, another kitchen, and more bathrooms on the Hope Haven campus. We estimate another $2.5 million will be needed complete the entire project but we're taking each step carefully as part of completing and sustaining the entire HHR vision. Rendering of finished construction project for Hope Haven's dream facility.Architect's rendering of building next to the finished building. We are sending two people to Rwanda. For every $5000 you donate, you get one raffle ticket for our drawing of an all-expense paid trip for two to Rwanda, only AFTER we meet our goal! We want you, our supporters,to see how your donation is changing the lives of this community and especially bringing new hope to these children for a more productive future. Please encourage your friends to join you in supporting HHR, so everyone has a chance to win that donates $5000!When we reach our fundraising goal, you will automatically be entered in our raffle with your purchased ticket(s) to win a trip to Rwanda to visit Hope Haven. Trip dates are flexible to the prize-winner. You will be staying in a guest house on the Hope Haven campus, and food produced in the community will be provided.All of the money we raise will go towards building a primary school building on the Hope Haven Rwanda land in Murindi. Because we are so appreciative of every penny of your donation, it all is used for the building project and outfitting the classrooms. This will not be possible without your help. If you want to know more about our educational program, want to see and read more about our plans, and learn more about Hope Haven Rwanda, or have any other questions/comments/concerns please contact us at susan@hopehavenrwanda.org and visit our website hopehavenrwanda.org and Facebook page!Additional Ways You Can HelpEveryone can contribute something which can help in a big ways!
Get the word out about Hope Haven Rwanda on social media and check us out on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook!
Share this Indiegogo page with everyone you know! We have an easy share link at the top! Maybe you know someone that wants to help us meet our funding goals! 
Tell your friends, family, mailman, dentist, church leader... everyone needs to know about what is happening in Rwanda!  Thank you <3

Check out our gallery of videos and photos! Tab is at the top!

story:
We will give education to every children !

My name is Veerawat Somnamka, I'm project leader of Laos Free School Projects. We travel around Laos to help and support non opportunity children to education. I and my team already helping children on Krong Som Wan, Ban Moo Pa and Koa Kae Village by building free elemental school and give education tools like books and blackboard.

Our Next Plan,

In January 2015, We have a plan to build a free elemental school for children in Bans Man, Laos. This village was deep in forest we can drive to this village by laterite road around 13 km long from concrete road on Bueng Kan street. This village don't have electric, most of children in Bans Man was uneducation because their nearest school, they have to walk around 34 km from their home to nearest school. Many family want their children to study but due to long distance and parent can not go with their child everyday, so many children have miss school.

Now,

Now, we currently survey the location and talk to chief villager and plan to start build elemental school on early January, 2015. We also buy a lot of books for their school library that can encourage children to love reading. 

Our Goal

We will build a free elemental school for eighty students and support their education with every our resource and every contribute we get. We hope to make a good environment for education for children and make every children want to study and improve their knowledge. We want everyone to be a part of this great event. Every donations will be use for children, education resource, books, toys, lunch for students. Every contribution will help this project to a great success.

Everyone Can Be a Part of This Project

I hope everyone can come join on our project in Laos. We have a tents and would be happy to see everyone care for children. By the ways, for anyone who contribute or donation for children is a great help too and everyone can share and promote this projects to a great success !

story:
Rosemunde and Roselinda are two of triplets. These two girls were born deaf, while their sister does not have this disability.  Kekeli is helping to provide an education for the two "Roses." These are two of the children who will be       supported through this campaign.

                                              


                     

I have begun to develop an inclusive school in the Volta Region of Ghana and am working with various organizations in Ghana to make this happen. Now I need to spread the message back home in the United States. $3,000 will provide a round trip ticket from Ghana to my home in New York State for regional lobbying efforts. It will also provide enough for me to travel to Washington, D.C., use public transportation to get to the meetings that have been prearranged, and purchase meals. I will save as much money as possible by staying with family members. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still do everything we can to make this happen. If we make more than our goal, any excess money will go to our work with children with disabilities.

These children take a break from class work.


Our budget:

Round-trip airfare (Delta/KLM) from Accra, Ghana to New York City    $2,094 Shuttle (round-trip plus tax & tip) from NYC to home near Albany, NY        200 Round-trip airfare (Southwest) to Baltimore and back to Albany                   256 Housing with a relative for one week in DC area (Hanover, MD)                           0 Commute from Hanover, MD-Washington, DC & meals during week            450                                                                                                                                             Total = $3,000

Your participation in helping us raise the money is vital: you can donate, you can spread the word to others and you can ask them to spread the word and donate, too! Everyone who donates will receive a little piece of Africa! (See our "perks!")

                                      How I Got Interested in Ghana

Ever since I was little, I wanted to study photography. Ever since I was in high school, I wanted to work in Africa. These two dreams became a reality in 2002 when, as a graduate student at Savannah College of Art and Design, I was able to spend a six month internship in Ghana, West Africa documenting life in the small fishing village of Woe by photographing the people in all aspects of their lives. I also spent time teaching photography to some of the children. I fell in love with the people and the country. Many volunteers to Ghana say they are going to return, but few ever do. I was determined that I would go back. I finished my degree, worked to save money and returned to Ghana volunteering to teach photography in three secondary schools.  I began to see more and more of the needs of the people, and I was hooked. I was especially touched when I worked in a special needs class and saw the pride the students felt as they learned to do something that many of their peers could not. I decided to start a not-for-profit, Kekeli, Inc.,  and continue working with students in Ghana. (Kekeli means daylight in the Ewe language.)

Why I Work With Ghana's Students With Special Needs 

I learned quickly that children born in Ghana with special needs were often hidden away. Their parents were afraid of the stigma of having a child who was "different," so they kept the child away from others. However, I also learned that these children often had much to offer, and I realized that education is as much a key to their development as it is to every child's. This led me to work towards the inclusion of children with special needs in the mainstream classrooms. We made slow, steady progress, but the work Kekeli has been doing with individual students can be multiplied if we develop an all-inclusive school where children with disabilities will learn alongside of all children.  To do this requires money. We already have support from two major organizations, one in Ho, Ghana and the other in Norwich, United Kingdom. But I need to return to the United States to work at raising money to begin and then to sustain this project.  Therefore, I need $3,000.

                                               Please Contribute!

Whatever you can give will help to start this inclusive school by enabling me to spread the word about the tremendous possibilities this school will create for students with disabilities. 

I cannot emphasize enough how important this campaign is to the children and to their families. Picture these situations:           

        1) the smile on Mawunyo's face when she finally went to school after spending the first 16 years of her life sitting in a plastic laundry basket. Kekeli provided her with a wheelchair, built a ramp to her house and convinced the school that she could learn.

                                             


        2) the pride in David's mother's eyes as she encourages other parents to advocate for their children. With Kekeli's support, she spent months doing physical therapy exercises with him, and David was finally able to walk using crutches.

                                                


        3) the joy that Selorm felt when he was accepted into secondary school. He failed his junior secondary school exam, because he could not write clearly enough for his exam to be read, but with Kekeli's help in providing computer support, he was able to retake his exam and get into secondary school.

Now imagine those opportunities multiplying when children with disabilities have access to an inclusive school! Your donation can help make that happen!

What I Have Done in the Past

I have created self-advocacy groups and parent advocacy groups to help children with disabilities and their families learn about their rights under Ghanaian law. This includes the right to an education.  I have worked with Ghana Educational Services and gained their support in promoting inclusive education within the schools, including providing special education teachers to work with students. I have worked with parents, teachers and disabled children to encourage them to work towards an education.

          One of Kekeli's self-advocacy groups - learning about their rights!


THANK YOU!

We are so grateful for your support that we want to give you  a little piece of Africa. These are some of the items in our "Perks" list.

Note cards


Earrings


Adinkra or elephant necklace or key chain

Drum necklace or key chain

Long beaded necklace

Book of photographs by Carrie Brown 


Kente Cloth Purses


Large Kente Cloth

Your contribution is valuable! I have been successful in finding educational opportunities for children with special needs. Now I want to reach more children and help them to achieve their dream of going to school, also. As they become educated, they will be able to contribute to their families and their communities. Please help!

Donate, then SPREAD THE WORD!

story:
Thank You!

Thank you so much to all who  helped us to reach our goal last year.

It is this time of the year again when we come closer to the LGBTQ Pride month in Ecuador. We will be celebrating it under a new light, speaking of the importance to reclaim public space. We have an ambotious schedule and we need of your help to accomplish it.

---

Breve reseña / Brief Overview

En Ecuador, la homosexualidad fue despenalizada en 1997,  pero solo a partir de 2005 se empieza a celebrar en el espacio público, a la vista de todos, sin miedo a la discriminación a través de la Marcha y Fiesta del Orgullo LGBTI, como una iniciativa de la Fundación Ecuatoriana Equidad. Son ya diez años en los que hemos visto cómo la participación y el entusiasmo, las ganas de salir y expresarse con libertad y alegría, han aumentado entre todos quienes nos autodefinimos como lesbianas, gays, bisexuales, personas trans e intersex y todos quienes nos apoyan. La lucha contra la discriminación hacia las personas LGBTI la hacemos con alegría, demostrando que el hecho de querer o amar a alguien de tu mismo sexo, o el expresar tu género de una manera diferente, no es una imposibilidad para vivir bien, ser felices y tener el mismo acceso a los beneficios de la ley y al uso del espacio público.

---

In Ecuador, homosexuality was decriminalized in 1997, but only since 2005 has it been celebrated in public spaces, with no fear of discrimination. This celebration started as an LGBTQ Pride rally and party organized by the Ecuadorian Foundation “Equidad”. It has been ten years since the first LGBTQ Pride week took place in Ecuador, and we have seen an exponential growth in the number of people coming out to the streets supporting the free expression of love and gender identity. We fight against discrimination with happiness, showing that loving someone of the same sex, or expressing your gender in a non-normative fashion, is not a roadblock towards having a great life and or accessing public spaces and legal rights.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes / What we need and what you get

Se viene el Orgullo LGBTI en Ecuador! Y este año desde este preciso instante puedes ser parte y apoyar a esta iniciativa. Necesitamos tu ayuda monetaria para hacer realidad la celebración del orgullo LGBTI. Nuestra meta es recaudar $8000. Cada dólar nos ayuda un montón.
---
It is the time of the LGBTQ Pride celebration in Ecuador! And this year, right now, you can become a part of this project. We need your financial support to make the LGBTQ Pride celebration a reality. Our goal is to raise 4,000 USD. Every bit will help us immensely!

El impacto / Impact

Queremos a través de las actividades organizadas en las Jornadas del Orgullo desaparecer las imposiciones sociales que nos oprimen, celebrar nuestras diferencias y dar a conocer que el ser lesbiana, gay, transexual, bisexual, intersex, no es una maldición, ni un estado inferior del ser humano, sino, la maravillosa posibilidad de querer a quien queremos querer y ser quien queremos ser.
---
Through the activities organized for the days of LGBTQ Pride, we want to vanish the social impositions that oppress us. We want to celebrate our differences and let other people know that being gay, lesbian, bisexual, intersex or queer is not a punishment, nor is it an inferior state of existence. Instead, it is simply the wonderful possibility of loving how and whom we want to love. And it is also the possibility of being exactly who we want to be. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar / Other ways in which you can help

Puedes ayudarnos posteando esta página en Facebook, en twitter, en cualquier lugar del mundo virtual o en el mundo real, contándole a tu familia, a tus amigos, a tus enemigos, a la vecina y a todos los demás. Y por supuesto asistiendo a los eventos de las Jornadas de Orgullo LGBTI. Vale mencionar que Indiegog es una prestigiosa plataforma mundial para recaudar fondos. Donar dinero es seguro, y no te cobran ningún gasto adicional por la transferencia.

---

You can help us by posting this page on facebook, twitter, anywhere on the internet or outside of it. You can help us by talking about our campaign with your family, your friends, your enemies, your neighbor, and everybody else. And of course, you can help us by showing up to the events and bringing people with you.

vecina y a todos los demás. Y por supuesto asistiendo a los eventos de las
Jornadas de Orgullo LGBTI. Vale mencionar que Indiegog es una prestigiosa plataforma mundial para recaudar fondos.
Donar dinero es seguro, y no te cobran ningún gasto adicional por la
transferencia.---You can help us by posting this page on
facebook, twitter, anywhere on the internet or outside of it. You can help us
by talking about our campaign with your family, your friends, your enemies,
your neighbor, and everybody else. And of course, you can help us by showing up
to the events and bringing people with you.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone!

My name is Punala Kiripitige, and I am a student at Saint Peter’s College, Adelaide, Australia. Saint Peter’s College promotes international mindedness, which is reflected in the International Baccalaureate Diploma. Approximately thirty male students, including myself, are undertaking this program. Completion of this program involves each student doing a project of community service. For this project of service five other students and myself are intending to help provide stationery supplies for one school year to an underprivileged school in Sri Lanka.

As I was born in Sri Lanka, prior to migrating to Australia, I had seen many underprivileged children who walk distances as far as eight kilometres per day to get to school with their precious stationery. For those not living in underprivileged circumstances, the importance of stationary is not even considered. 

As the Sri Lankan government provides textbooks for schooling, it is the children's responsibility to buy stationery for themselves. Many parents of these children are themselves finding life enduring many hardships and simply not earn enough money to even feed the family. Given that we are fortunate enough to live in a privileged country, with high quality education, I think it is absolutely vital that we help those who cannot afford to live their lives the same ways as us.

I would like us combined together to achieve a total of $2000AUD so that we can provide stationery for one whole year level to an underprivileged school in Sri Lanka.

If we could reach that goal it would help a lot of young people!

Please contribute!

Thank You!



What We Need & What You Get

The goal that we need to achieve in order to gain sufficient funds for stationery for all students in an underprivileged school in Sri Lanka will be $2000AUD.

I find tremendous happiness in bringing smiles to those who do not have the same lives as ours, and believe that you will find great happiness too in contributing to this worthwhile cause. 

Even if the goal is not achieved, the funds still go towards the same cause, however, we will have to employ other fundraising methods to reach the target. Therefore, it would be an amazing help if as many people as possible contributed to this great cause.

The Impact

Education is one of the most effective ways in reducing poverty and low income. If children are provided with a good education, they can become inspirational role models to the next generation, working in highly respected professions and roles, such as doctors, engineers, pilots, and world leaders. The increase of stable occupations will subsequent increase a country’s demand, hence increase the overall conditions of that country in relation to economic and social status. 

I have completed other service community projects before, which has included volunteering, however, nothing to such a large-a-scale. I am a trustworthy and high-achieving student who aspires to help people in need.

If you would to know more about this initative, please don't hestiate to contact me at: punalakiripitige@yahoo.com.au

Risks & Challenges

One of the major issues concerning fundraising campaigns is often the issue of handling of funds and ensuring the authenticity of the campaign. However, what distinguishes our fundraising initiative from the rest is that I was born in Sri Lanka and my parents are both Sri Lankan, having lived extensively in these kind of villages, which means that we have direct connections to many of these poor areas in Sri Lanka. We have made friends with those who have very little, as well as those villages who are less fortunate.  We will be working with these village officials to ensure that funds are being used efficiently and properly.

After the goal of $2000AUD is raised, the funds will be collected in one bank account and transferred to an account in Sri Lanka, after which one of our family friends who is also a village official would provide the funds to a poor school in the area. The village official will ensure that stationery and exercise books are bought for all of the children in the school and none of the money is used for other purposes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute directly, please share this fundraising campaign with your friends and social media such as facebook and twitter and help get others to donate for a good cause.

story:
Hi, I'm Sheri Smith, CEO of the Indigo Project. The Indigo Project is a grassroots movement to empower students to find a path to work they will love.

My vision is an educational system that helps students understand and achieve their true potential. We appreciate your support in joining the Indigo Project Movement and helping make this vision a reality.

Today, students face many challenges in actualizing their potential:

  1. The metrics used by the education system to measure students today have no correlation to life success.
      
  2. Schools don't teach students who they are or where their true genius lies.

  3. What schools do teach doesn't prepare students for life in the 21st century.  

  4. Furthermore, there is little transparency to the educational system - students don't know how likely they are to graduate, get a job, or how much it's really going to cost long-term.  
My goal is to change all of this and I would like your help. It's a big task, but there is a way to do it. I'll show you how...
   

How do we help students achieve their potential?

It all starts with the metrics used to measure students' abilities and their progress through school.  Today's metrics, standardized tests and GPAs, have no correlation to a student's success in life, nor do they teach a student anything meaningful about who they really are.  I came across this problem many times when hiring and training sales people.  I noticed that those who succeeded were a great fit both for the role and for the company they worked for.  Those who failed were incredibly talented in other areas, but their strengths and passions were not applicable to the sales job we were hiring them for. 

We've all seen this - a great person in the wrong job.  As a child I remember my grandfather telling me why he retired early from engineering - he was promoted to a be a manager and he hated it.   His work became so unbearable that he quit.  He was an incredible engineer but a terrible manager.  Even then I felt sad for Gran-pa-pa and knew his company had lost a great asset by forcing him into the wrong role.

So what's the solution?

The solution starts with using the right metrics so we can really understand: 

  • who each student is, 
  • what work they would love, 
  • and the best way for them to get there.  

The Indigo Project helps students know themselves so they can find the path to work they love.  The same metrics I used to help companies find the right fit, I'm now using with students and educators as the Indigo Assessment, creating powerful results (more about that later).  

The solution also entails transparency in the educational system.  

  • How likely are you to graduate from a particular university?  
  • If you do graduate, what jobs are you likely to get?  
  • If you land one of those jobs, are you going to like it?  
  • And will the cost of your education be a good investment?
The student resources we are building are designed to encourage transparency in the educational system by presenting the reality of college and career options. We are also highlighting alternative types of post secondary training and emerging fields for the Innovation Age.  


    Sadly, the statistics today on higher education are abysmal. 

    Today's young generation is projected to be the first in the history of America to be financially worse off than their parents.  

    _________________

    Having a college degree is increasingly important in the job market, yet only about half who begin a degree actually graduate.  

    Of those who do graduate, half of those are unemployed or underemployed. And of the ones who do get jobs, the vast majority don't enjoy their work.

    _________________

    Moreover, the cost of education has increased 72% in a decade, while starting salaries have decreased by almost 15%.  

    In short, many college graduates end up doing work they don't love and aren't prepared for, while incurring more debt to make less money. 
    The situation is so challenging that 85% of graduates end up living at home with their parents after graduating.  

    These statistics sum up why something needs to be done.  I would like you to help me do something about this problem!  

    _________________

    Ready to help?              

                 Join now by selecting a perk                                           
                                   - and -     Share with your friends.

    _________________

    Already making a difference

    In 2013 I started a company to tackle this problem.  We developed the Indigo Report in partnership with TTI and it's already making a difference:  

    • The University of Nebraska Environmental Studies program has completely transformed their program using our metrics and the results are outstanding: 100% of their students land jobs after graduation.  
    • Eight students in a pilot program at Peak to Peak High School went from 30 failing grades to 3 in just ten weeks.  

    • Individual students receiving their Indigo Report have found new hope and validation when the school system has been telling them otherwise. Watch Haley's and Tom's stories below.  

    We are already making an impact and will continue to do even more as our company grows.  So why a crowdfunding campaign?

    One of the reasons why I'm doing an Indiegogo campaign is because I want to know how you feel about to this message.  Do you believe in evolving education?  You can start now, whether you are young or old.  It's never too late!  I want to give you the opportunity to support change, as well as to begin pursuing your own passions.

    ___________________________

    Which gets to the perks I'm offering

    • For $10 you can say yes to this idea and let me know that you care about what I'm doing.

    • For $50 you can say yes to this idea, take the Indigo Report, and learn more about your own passions.  We will register you in our database and as we build our company and connect passions to career and educational choices, we will send you opportunities you'll be excited about.  When you buy a $50 perk, we also give a free Indigo Report to a student in need.  Read more about our 501c3 program. 

    • For $100 you can say yes to this idea, take the Indigo Report, and promote Indigo by wearing one of our beautiful T-shirts!  

    • For $500 you can help 20 people in need take the Indigo Assessment.  We are working with universities to help them be more inclusive in granting promising low-income students scholarships for college educations.  

    • For $1,000 you can help us make a job/education video. Check out our video on G-school.
    • For $10,000 you can help us make 10 job videos and your name will appear in the credits.  

    • For $25,000 you can become a sponsor of our mini documentary on just how bad the educational system is and what the solutions are.  You attend the premier night, have dinner with me and your name is in the credits.  
    A note about why we selected $250,000 as our goal. Compared to the size of our mission, it's actually a very small amount.  Half of all money raised on Indiegogo will  automatically go toward helping students in need.  The other half will go toward creating online resources to support student learning.  We picked $250,000 because after giving half away we we need the additional capital to create our documentary, alternative education database, job videos, and online matching system.  The Indigo Project is an organic movement.  No matter what happens on Indiegogo, we will continue to build our company, help students find a path to work they love, and pursue our goal of evolving education.  This is our passion - we are committed to doing whatever it takes to see this vision through.  
    ____________________________
     

    Does the Indigo Assessment really work?

    I recently conducted a workshop at Peak to Peak High School with guidance counselor Kimberly Gannett that changed the lives of 8 "at-risk" students.

    Carey McClure, professional college career counselor, emotionally talks about her daughter Haley's experience with the Indigo Report.

    Watch Jane find a new perspective on her son with the Indigo Report.  Tom is another example of the educational system missing a student's tremendous potential. 

     

    ____________________________

    How the Indigo Report is different than personality tests

    The Indigo Report is not a "touchy-feely" personality test. It's backed by 30 years of research, and is used by numerous Fortune 500 companies to hire and develop employees in 90 countries.  It is the best non-cognitive tool on the market. 

    The most frequent comment we get from people who take the Indigo Report is, "This is the most meaningful assessment I've ever taken!" 
    Dr. Ron Bonnstetter, Director of R&D at TTI and a member of our Board of Directors discusses the validity of the Indigo.  You can watch his full story on our website.

    ___________

    Want to help spread the impact?              

                 Join now by selecting a perk                                           
                                   - and -     Share with your friends.

    _________________


    What does the Indigo Report tell you... about you?

    The Indigo Report combines 4 sciences that reveal your strengths, behaviors, motivators and skills.  Based on your unique combination, the report provides you with potential fields of study and career opportunities that you would thrive in.  

    To get a better idea of what you can do with this information, let me tell you what my report tells me... about me.  

    I'm very high Dominance, high Influencing on the DISC behaviors graph.  High D's tend to be competitive, decisive, and determined. High I's tend to be enthusiastic, persuasive, and optimistic.  I sort-of knew these things about myself, but seeing it in the report and being able to compare my extreme scores to normative samples helped me understand where I will thrive, and what environments I should avoid in the workplace. 

    If I had known this at 18, I would have realized that the government career I was pursuing and majoring in was a terrible fit.  I need a fast paced, dynamic environment where I can be a results oriented leader and be free of repetitive and detailed work (low Compliance).    

    When you have your DISC scores, you can better choose your classes, field of study, and understand your strengths and weakness when working with other people.    

    So what motivates me? 

    I'm a passionate Social, and slightly above average Utilitarian, so making money without making an impact on society will never satisfy me.  That's why I started a social enterprise, but always felt repelled by Wall Street. 

    Motivators help you know "why" you do the things you do.  I tell students the best way to point yourself in a fulfilling direction is to look at your top two motivators.  For example, if your top motivator is Aesthetic, make sure your college environment provides a harmonious living environment.  Surroundings matter to high Aesthetics.  

    Your 26-page Indigo Report reveals this and much more, including higher education options that match your passions. Here are a few options that my report suggested for me.  I didn't even know what an entrepreneur was when I was in college - now there are many opportunities for young entrepreneurs.  Read more details on our website.
    _________________
    Want to get your report now?  Click on the $50 perk and we will send you a link to take the Indigo within 48 hours.  It takes about 45 minutes and your report will automatically be emailed to you.  
    _________________

    Our commitment to inclusion:

    We created the Indigo Foundation (501c3 status pending)  as part of our company's commitment to inclusion.  The goal of the Indigo Foundation is to provide the Indigo Assessment free of cost to low income students.  Half the money we raise on Indiegogo will be automatically donated to a students in need.  We are already working with several organizations.  

    Our first Boys and Girls Club Indigo workshop was held in July via our technology partner, TTI.  Here's what some of the participants had to say:

    • "I learned what my strengths are and to respect people's differences." Chase
    • "I learned that the career I am going after matched my personality type." Vivian
    • "I learned that we need other people with different personalities to create a great team." Vanessa
    • "People should not try to change others. They are who they are and don't need to change." Harrison
    Another of our partners is Project Voyce, a Denver non-profit seeking "to empower youth to create positive change within themselves, their school, their community, and the world."  Listen to the inspired students of Project Voyce share their dreams and perspectives on college and career choices:
     

    ____________________________

    Some of the people we've worked with

    _________________________

    Indigo Report testimonials:

    "It helped me to look at my life in the big picture and to explain why I am me."         
             - Santiago A.

    "It really gives you a new perspective on what you CAN do with your life and not what you HAVE to do."       
              - Allison L.

    "This product is the future... 
               - Jim Maraviglia -- CalPoly University,  ‎Associate Vice Provost

    "It makes you realize you have one life and it's worth living well."
              – Cully Brown, High School Senior

    It actually helps as opposed to personality tests online."
              - Taylor C., High School Senior

    I've never seen my students so engaged…"
                - Vincent Pizziconi -- ASU Department of Bio Engineering, Professor 

    "At a recent College Prep Camp, we had over 80 students take the Indigo assessment prior to beginning their college search. For the first time in their young lives, these students got an internal look at themselves, to understand one another as individuals.  Thank you Indigo for helping provide invaluable clarity!"
              - Kerstyn Pocklington, Ready.Aim.Future, Founder  

    _____________________________

    Finding our place in the world

    It’s time to encourage students to stop trying to fit in a box and find their own place in the world.  I believe that we all belong and have exquisite gifts to give. One father expressed it this way:

    Our son Oliver is going through the college selection process. If those who serve as gate keepers could truly see him, in all his glory, they’d all take him in a moment. 
    • They’d take him for his wisdom in navigating the difficult choices of adolescence without losing himself. 
    • They’d take him for the energy wound up in him like a spring, just waiting to be harnessed. 
    • They’d take him for his calm under pressure; for his smile. 
    But then, if we truly saw one another for the gifts we carry, every child would be viewed this way. Everyone would find a welcome somewhere. 
    - Carl Whiting, Professor and Father

    _________________

    Like what we are up to?               
                    Join now by selecting a perk                                           
                                             - and -     Share with your friends.
    _________________

    A BIG Thank You from our team in Boulder, CO!
